entry.title: The Power of One: How Unified SAP Joule Boosts AI Adoption (a technical sight)
entry.content:
Short read. Big pictures.

What is ‘Unified SAP Joule’? One Joule for all SAP solutions, independent of the underlying tech stacks. (End users know ‘SAP,’ not SFSF/S4/BS, etc.)

Why unify? Better user acceptance → better adoption. If users don’t accept it, they won’t adopt it.

How to get there? Use the SAP IAM Reference Architecture for SAP Joule as the backbone, following down below:

 

1) Overview

Everything SAP‑labeled shows up to the corporate IAM/IdP as SAP Cloud Identity (SCI). Inside the SAP domain, identities & authorizations are unified so the landscape can be SAP‑managed later. User management, role/group assignment, and authentication all go through SAP Cloud Identity Services.

 

2) Common Data Model (CDM)

At design time – when activating SAP Joule, each business solution (e.g., S/4HANA) exposes its Joule capabilities via CDM. Joule functions map to business roles; CDM content is deployed to SAP Build Work Zone (WZ); Roles defined in CDM appear as roles in Content Manager.
E.g. S4 HANA Capability <-> S/4 HANA Business Role <-> CDM role <-> Role in WZ <-> Capability in WZ.
Given that, SAP Joule knows at DT what authorizations a user need for which capability.

 

3) Sync of Authorizations

Roles/groups and identity assignments from business solution (S/4 HANA, SuccessFactors, …) synchronize into Work Zone. Synchronizing groups and assignments into SCI are optional today and may become required if WZ polls SCI. Third‑party IAM can assign groups to users via SCI; Work Zone’s user store is independent of XSUAA.

 

4) Sync of Identities

Identities flow through SCIM to your identity management, centrally governed across SAP. The Global Unique User Identifier is synchronized from SCI into the business solutions.

 

5) Authentication Flow

All authentication goes through SAP Cloud Identity Services (IAS), enabling principal propagation behind the scenes (later more). This is the basis for Unified SAP Joule and prepares the path for SAP‑managed connectivity when new services are subscribed.

 

6) Example: End‑to‑End Authentication

  1. User opens Joule.
  2. Joule asks IAS to authenticate user; Optional: IAS forwards authentication to Corporate IdP and enriches token with IAS information (GUUID) after authentication (identity federation).
  3. User is authenticated to use Joule while Joule knows, which capabilities the user is allowed to use.
  4. User is calling a Joule capability (e.g. Create leave request).
  5. Joule asks IAS for a token for this specific identity for the business solution of the capability to be called.
  6. IAS is handing out the token.
  7. Joule can authenticate as the user to the business solution (principal propagation).
  8. Joule calling the function module inside the business solution in the name of the user.

This illustrates the importance for all solutions and the BTP within this scenario to trust the same authentication instance (IAS).

 

7) 3rd‑Party Identity Management (where it fits)

  • Identity sources: SFSF (internals), Fieldglass (externals), or AD.
  • Synchronization of users between SFSF and SCI.
  • GUUID is written back to SFSF.
  • Groups originate in SaaS solutions and show as SCI groups can sync to 3rd-party IAM.
  • S/4 HANA roles can sync to 3rd‑party IAM.
  • Management split:
    • BTP & SaaS via SCI.
    • S/4 HANA via IAM directly plus GUUID provisioning:
      • IAM reads from SCI and provisions to S/4 HANA, or
      • SCI reads from S/4 HANA and writes back UserID+GUUID only;
      • Both option align with the reference architecture.

 

Final thought

Unify identity and auth once → unlock Joule everywhere. Less friction. More adoption. Happier users. 🎯

Public source for architectural drawings: IAM Reference Architecture for SAP Joule in Architecture Center

entry.title: SAP S4 HANA Finance integration and Use case with SAP Joule
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

Deployment & Integration

  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.

Feature Availability

  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.

Customization & Extensibility

  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.

Data Security & Residency

  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.

Upgrade & Innovation

  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

 Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)

  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  • Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  • Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  • Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.

Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

 

 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

 Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

 Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
     “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
    • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

Key Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

entry.title: Meet Joule: Your New AI Assistant in SAP Ariba
entry.content:
Get ready for a smarter, faster way to work. Meet Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, now integrated into the SAP Ariba suite. Think of Joule as your personal assistant, ready to help you navigate the application, answer your questions, and even perform tasks for you—all through simple, natural language.

Let's explore how Joule will make your day-to-day work in SAP Ariba easier.

(For the latest availability, always check the official Joule Capabilities Guide.)

1. Your On-Demand Ariba Expert

Instead of digging through product documentation on the SAP Help Portal, you can now ask Joule directly. It understands your questions and provides clear, concise answers with direct links to the source documents if you want to learn more. This means less time searching and more time doing.

You can ask questions like:

  • "How do I find registered suppliers? Show me the steps."
  • "How can I track the progress of supplier onboarding?"
  • "What is an aggregated requisition?"
  • "How do I add taxes and discounts to an invoice?"
  • "Can I export questionnaires from a sourcing event?"
  • "What are common invoice exceptions?"

 

 

 

 

2. Turn Conversation into Action

Joule isn't just for answering questions; it's for getting work done. You can use it to interact with the system and manage your business processes without navigating through multiple screens. This feature transforms routine transactional tasks into a simple conversation.

This includes tasks like approving purchase requisitions or performing other create, read, update, and delete actions across Ariba.

For example, you can simply ask:

  • "Show me all tasks that are pending my approval."
  • Once Joule displays the list, you can follow up with: "Approve requisition 9876."

This allows you to handle your to-do list quickly and efficiently, directly from the chat window.

 

 

 

3. Navigate Across Ariba Seamlessly

The SAP Ariba suite contains several powerful applications for buying, sourcing, and supplier management. Joule works across them without missing a beat. You can switch between topics and applications in the same chat window, and Joule will remember the context of your conversation.

Imagine you're asking about a specific supplier's risk profile in Supplier Management. You can immediately pivot and ask, "Show me active sourcing events with this supplier," without having to start a new query. Joule maintains the context, providing a smooth and uninterrupted workflow that saves you from juggling multiple tabs and losing your train of thought.

 

 

 

 

Ready to Get Started? Here's How

You can activate Joule's capabilities in your SAP Ariba applications TODAY. Before you begin, ensure you have the following prerequisites in place:

  • Required Systems & Access:
    • An SAP Ariba Realm.
    • SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) with a Global Administrator.
    • SAP Cloud Identity Services (highly recommended) configured for user logon, along with an administrator for the service.
    • If you are not using SAP Cloud Identity Services, you will need a third-party user with Ariba Core Administrator access.
  • Commercials:
    • Ensure you have the necessary Joule licensing

For a detailed walkthrough of the setup and configuration process, check out the official Joule Integration with SAP Ariba Setup Guide on the SAP Community portal.

Special thanks to Alejandro, Bertrand and Joule Ariba Team for their support.

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 Release: What’s New & What Matters
entry.content:
SAP’s H2 2025 SuccessFactors release isn’t chasing headlines, it’s about foundation. After the wave of Joule and AI announcements earlier this year, this release focuses on what truly matters for customers and partners: consistency, data quality, and modernization.

What this really means is that SAP is tightening every bolt, from the redesigned People Profile to the smallest validation rule - to make sure SuccessFactors can handle the next phase of intelligent, connected HXM.

Key Themes in the 2H 2025 Release

1️⃣  Full Profile redesign everywhere

The editing and history experiences in the latest People Profile have been completely reimagined. Dependents, contact data, and emergency information now follow the same modern pattern - intuitive, streamlined, and consistent.

2️⃣ Cleaner data and smarter rules

Across Employee Central, Time, and Benefits, SAP introduced tighter validations, better error handling, and enhanced rule contexts. This ensures data accuracy and consistency across modules.

3️⃣ Streamlined employment lifecycle

From hire to rehire, from job changes to terminations, the end-to-end employment process is smoother, more automated, and more predictable.

4️⃣ Extensibility-first mindset

The new Extensibility Wizard on SAP BTP is now generally available, simplifying in-app and side-by-side extensions - a key step toward modular innovation.

5️⃣ Legacy cleanup continues

SAP continues to retire older frameworks, including the legacy People Profile, YouCalc workflows, classic accrual methods, and outdated SOAP APIs.

Let’s start with my favorite, the heart of the SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite.

Employee Central

Employee Central (EC) continues to mature with emphasis on data visibility, permissions, and accuracy.

  • New History UI of Full Profile: History UI for Full Profile provides more streamlined experience when you manage previous, current, and future records of effective-dated entities.
  • Position Management: new validations and configuration consistency : 💪
    • Validation of Event Reason with Position Reclassification Follow-Up Process
    • Error Messages for Missing Employee Central Event Publishing Configuration Object
    • Enhancements in Right to Return Configuration
    • Enhanced Position Validation when Hiring an Employee with a Fixed-Term Contract
    • Position Job Requisition Processing Job Type Moved to Scheduled Job Manager
    • Moving Positions When Changing An Employee's Manager Assignment available for Promotion, Demotion and Transfer Quick Actions
    • Defaulting of the Manager or Position and Hierarchy Adaptation After Imports for Termination imports
  • Quick Actions : define ESS/MSS templates by country for common tasks.
  • Inactive Employment Access : employees can now view data from inactive employments.
  • Talent Data Transfer : move an individual’s talent data from inactive to active employment in one go.
  • Customizable Alert Notifications Using Document Generation : Document template per language and link it to the new Alert category group.
  • Improved HRIS Sync : detailed execution logs in Scheduled Job Manager.
  • Enhanced Permission Roles for Accessing Employee Data During Rehire: Define target populations for rehiring inactive employees on old or new employment through the Duplicate Check.
  • New Work Order Requires New Employment : Concurrent Employment for Contingent Workers renamed toNew Work Order Requires New Employment.
  • Workflow Enhancements in Latest People Profile.
  • API Enhancements : customString1 and lastDateWorked now filterable in OData APIs; character-based length validation introduced.

The overall tone is clear -- EC is being refined for reliability and audit-readiness.

Onboarding

Onboarding continues its evolution toward clarity and compliance stability.

  • Automate Onboarding Initiation from Recruiting.
  • A clear banner reminds administrators that Onboarding 1.0 reaches end of maintenance in 2H 2025 and deletion in 1H 2026.
  • New Onboarding Featured Cards on the Latest Home Page.
  • Mandatory Event Reason for Onboarding Process Initiation.
  • Employer signature rules renamed for easier configuration.
  • Error messaging during E-Verify and document upload is now explicit and contextual.
  • Enhancements to the U.S.C.I.S. Form I-9 💪
  • Automate National ID Information Extraction in Onboarding via SAP Document AI
    • SAP Document AI, embedded edition can extract the following information from the National ID :
      • Country/Region
      • National ID Card Type
      • National ID (Number)
      • Valid to
      • Valid from
  • Retaining New Hire Personal Information During Automatic Restart of Onboarding Process.

These refinements make the Onboarding experience far less error-prone and fully aligned with the new People Profile design.

Recruiting

Recruiting receives a language and layout overhaul for usability and consistency.

  • .Applicant Filtering by Assessment Score and Recommendation.
  • Simplified button labels such as Add Competencies, Close, Add to Talent Pool.
  • Browser tab titles and menu structures standardized across Job Requisition and Applicant Management pages.
  • Breadcrumb navigation added for candidates in the new Candidate Experience.
  • Automatic Transfer of Recruiting Skills to Growth Portfolio 💪
    • Only skill names are transferred to the Growth Portfolio. Proficiency levels must be updated manually.
  • Clearer menu grouping — Manage Requisition, Manage Job Postings, Manage Applicants.
  • Candidate Profile Extension in the Redesigned Applicant Management Tool
  • Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) using Identity Authentication Service (IAS) for Agency Users.

Small changes, yes — but they bring a big impact in how recruiters and candidates experience the hiring process. The real story, though, is what’s happening behind the scenes: SAP’s acquisition of SmartRecruiters.

This move signals a clear intent to strengthen SuccessFactors’ end-to-end recruiting capabilities, especially around AI-driven sourcing, CRM-style candidate nurturing, and intelligent matching. Over time, expect deeper integration between SmartRecruiters’ talent acquisition engine and SuccessFactors Recruiting 😉, blurring the lines between applicant tracking and experience management.

In short, it’s a quiet update with major strategic depth - and definitely one to keep a close eye on.

Learning

Learning continues its modernization path with focus on data integrity and AI-aligned skill handling.

  • Numeric-only validation for cost and hour fields in External Learning Requests.
  • Skill Standardization via SAP Business AI : supports both standardized and alternate skill names in the taxonomy.
  • Peer comments and Suggested By now visible on the Course Home.
  • Bulk Delete Unused iContent Files From Learning Administration 💪
  • Updated labels: View More → Show More, Register Employees → Finish Registration, Recommend → Submit.
  • Fix for multiple employments – same course now appears under each employment with relevant action buttons.

These changes improve both the learner experience and data alignment for AI-based recommendations.

Time Management & Tracking

Time Management becomes even more compliance-ready and automated.

  • Geofencing for Clock Time 💪

    • Only Google Maps is currently supported to render the maps shown in the application. If Google Maps isn't supported in your country/region, then you won't be able to use the Geofencing feature.
  • Automatic recalculation for changes in Holiday Calendars.
  • Yearly view in team absence calendar
  • Absences in weeks (especially for Australian compliance).
  • FMLA Dashboard integration with third-party providers in the U.S.
  • Deduction field now separate from “Requesting” for better clarity.
  • Permanent time accounts now replicable to SAP Payroll.

Each of these refinements increases transparency and reliability in time processing.

People Profile & Mobile Experience

The People Profile transformation continues at full speed.

  • New Editing UI and History UI for Full Profile.
  • Dependents, emergency contacts, and personal data UIs redesigned for accuracy.
  • Validation ensures one dependent can be linked to only one employee.
  • IsPrimary fields (contact, phone, email) become read-only once set.
  • Audit tracking now available for Full Profile category configurations.

Mobile updates:

  • Ability to switch between multiple active employments.
  • Save profile contacts directly to phone contacts.
  • Performance forms link to latest profile cards.
  • Enhanced proxy access security.

The user experience is now unified across desktop and mobile — a key prerequisite for AI-driven contextual insights.

Platform, Extensibility & Identity

Platform capabilities continue to expand quietly but significantly.

  • Job Profile Builder and Talent Intelligence Hub : Available by Default on New Tenants. 💪
  • MFA for critical transactions : optional multi-factor verification for sensitive actions.
  • Identity & Access Management (RBP) : collapsible search, cleaner labels, improved tooltips.
  • Instance Refresh Tool : new Check Quota option, reduced scheduling window to 3 months.
  • Public Links for Hosting Static Content : A new self-service capability -- upload static content and generate public links directly from a new tool in the Admin Center.
  • Extensibility Wizard on SAP BTP : enables in-app and side-by-side extensions.
  • Long-Time Login : Now users, with long-time login, users can remain logged in for up to 3 months without needing to re-authenticate.
  • People Analytics Product Name Is No Longer in Use : "Stories in People Analytics" is changed to "Story reports".

These backend improvements give administrators more control and transparency in managing large, multi-tenant environments.

Deprecations & End-of-Maintenance

Area Feature End of Maintenance & Deletion
TitleDescriptionEnd of MaintenanceDeletion
People ProfileLegacy Editing & History UINov 2027Nov 2027
Learning SearchDeprecation of Legacy Learning SearchNov 2025May 2027
WorkflowsXML-based (YouCalc) triggeringNov 2023May 2026
Time ManagementClassic accrual posting methodMay 2025Dec 2025
APIsSOAP-based EC APIs (except CompoundEmployee)May 2024Nov 2026
Pay ScalePicklist & APINov 2023Nov 2026
RehireRehire Inactive Employees pageMay 2025May 2026
People ProfileDeprecation of Data Viewing in Legacy People ProfileMay 2026May 2026

Action: Review these components before 2026.

Joule & GenAI Positioning

While this release is primarily functional, the AI foundation is unmistakable.

  • Strengthened data validations and consistent rule contexts ensure Joule consumes clean data.
  • Full Profile redesign supports contextual, skill-aware insights for AI assistants.
  • Extensibility Wizard simplifies integration of Joule skills and AI extensions.
  • Talent Intelligence Hub updates (timeline, proficiency visibility, “Not Rated” option) enhance semantic data for AI reasoning.
  • New transactional Joule use case — View Time Off Instructions (July 2025) — moves from navigation to transactional execution.

Final Take

If the 1H 2025 release was about launching Joule and introducing new AI ideas, 2H 2025 is about making the system ready for them.

UI modernization, better validation, and deprecation cleanup might not sound glamorous, but they decide how well your environment supports AI and analytics tomorrow.

  • Move fully to the latest People Profile.
  • Review and clean up inactive employment and dependent data.
  • Validate and update Quick Actions and workflows.
  • Plan for deprecations before 2026.
  • Start adopting the BTP Extensibility Wizard for future extensions.

2H 2025 is a foundation release — solid, stable, and designed to make your system Joule-ready by default.

Take time to explore these features in your preview environment, adjust configurations as needed, and collaborate with your recruiting teams to ensure a smooth rollout and optimal impact.

For full technical documentation, visit the SAP SuccessFactors What's New Viewer

For this release, I tried something different. Instead of writing separate blogs for each module, I focused on the most meaningful and interesting upgrades — the ones that actually matter. I’d love to hear what you think. Should I stick with this format or go back to module-wise blogs? If you enjoyed it, a kudo would mean a lot.

entry.title: Part 1 - Boost Your ABAP Productivity with Joule: Explain & detect Test Dependencies
entry.content:
Hello folks,

Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities in SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition or SAP BTP ABAP Environment is technically available in all development tenants since release 2502. Follow the note 3571857  to know the pre-requisites to have the Joule capabilities in your IDE.

Joule currently supports three powerful AI-assisted actions directly inside ADT / IDE:


ExplainUnderstand the code instantly
Find Test-Unfriendly DependenciesIdentify interfaces, DB objects, or classes blocking unit testability
Generate Unit Tests (AUnits)Auto-create ABAP test classes with mocks and test case
 
All these capabilities are very useful unless you know how to really provide the context into the Joule. Let’s understand them one by one.

This series of blog is constitutes of two parts:

  1. Explain and Find Test-Unfriendly dependencies
  2. Generate Unit Tests(Aunits)

Let's look at the capability(1) - "Explain" 

There are some ways to do so. Let’s try each and see the differences. I have created a demo class for demonstrating the Joule capabilities in IDE.

Approach 1 - Right-click on method name in project explorer→ Joule → Explain 

Since at this point, Joule can only read the parameters of the method, it is not giving very useful info about the method.

Hmm, what else we can do to provide more context to Joule?

Yes, there is a way!

Approach 2 - Select the implementation of the code → Right-click →Joule → Explain 

As the selected code has the given the context to Joule to read the code, Joule explains it very easily.

What’s next? Can we know more about the method in detail? Yes we can and we have 2 options for it–

You can click any of it and this will give you more explanation.

Like I selected explain in more detail.

Now Joule is even more technical, it is explaining code, method signature, technical explanation and finally the conclusion.

Let’s see how the capability(2) - "Test-Unfriendly dependencies" work with the help of Joule.

This capability helps you to prepare the code for unit testing by listing external dependencies like interfaces, CDS views, database tables, or classes. Let's see the steps below:

Step1 - Right-click on the class → Joule → Start Chat for AUnits


Step 2 - Click on Find Test-Unfriendly Dependencies

Click on Find Test-Unfriendly Dependencies and Joule will list all the Test-Unfriendly dependencies like interfaces, database objects (CDS, tables), classes etc.

In this case, this class is dependent on an interface. You can click on the list and Joule will navigate you to the source code where the dependent object is used.

This brings to the one of the most powerful capabilities(3)  - "Generate Unit Tests".

It is covered in the next part of the blog.

Note - There is no standard way of doing this activity, this is my tried and tested way for enriching the code context to Joule and it does a good job. Always make sure to review any generated code or suggestion to finally use in your code.

entry.title: Part 2 - Boost Your ABAP Productivity with Joule: Generate Unit Tests(AUnits)
entry.content:
Hello enthusiasts, 

The series of blog is constitutes of two parts:

  1. Explain and Find Test-Unfriendly dependencies
  2. Generate Unit Tests(Aunits)

As explained in the part-1 of the blog, Joule currently supports three powerful AI-assisted actions directly inside ADT / IDE:


ExplainUnderstand the code instantly
Find Test-Unfriendly DependenciesIdentify interfaces, DB objects, or classes blocking unit testability
Generate Unit Tests (AUnits)Auto-create ABAP test classes with mocks and test case

This is the part-2 of the blog series, here we are going to understand  one of the most powerful capabilities of Joule in IDE - "Generate Unit Tests".

There are some ways to generate the ABAP Units, Let’s looks at them one-by-one.

Approach 1 - Do a right click on the method you want to generate the Aunit and Joule will propose the Aunit code.

Joule has proposed 2 test methods – Check_m1_valid_data and Check_m1_empty_result

The code is comparing the result with “Valid Result’ and we don’t even have it in our method Check_M1 and the reason  is - Joule does not have the context of the implementation code of CHECK_M1.

Let’s do with the second way.

Approach B - Select the implementation code and ask Joule to explain the code.

This gives the Joule the context about the code and now it becomes better to write Aunits.

Ask to explain in more details like we did in the previous part of the blog.

Give the prompt – Find test-unfriendly dependencies of this method.

Give the prompt to Joule - Generate the ABAP unit for this method with the help of test doubles for the test-unfriendly dependencies.

Here, we go!

Joule has identified mi_data and /ape/if_proc_data~get_proc_data as dependencies.

This is the real power of Joule, it has not just created test methods to cover “Passed” and “failed” cases but also has done an incredible job to create mock data for mi_data.

So, the key is –

  1. Select the code and ask Joule to explain.
  2. Ask to find test dependencies like -   find the test-dependencies of the method check_determine_counter
  3. And then ask Joule to write AUNIT taking test doubles into consideration for the test-dependencies.

Note - There is no standard way of doing this activity, this is my tried and tested way for enriching the code context to Joule and it does a good job. Always make sure to review any generated code or suggestion to finally use in your code.

entry.title: Brazil as One of the Leading Hubs for Artificial Intelligence (2024–2025)
entry.content:
Over the past two years, Brazil has established itself as one of the main Artificial Intelligence (AI) hubs globally, standing out for its combination of public investments, expanding business ecosystem, and regulatory progress. Traditionally a leader in innovation and technology in Latin America, Brazil is now attracting international attention by accelerating the adoption of AI across strategic sectors such as finance, energy, agribusiness, and public services.

In 2024, the Brazilian government launched the Brazilian Artificial Intelligence Plan (PBIA) 2024–2028, a program with an estimated investment of R$ 23 billion dedicated to AI research, development, and infrastructure. The plan aims to strengthen technological sovereignty, foster innovation through universities, and support companies in applying AI to practical use cases, particularly in areas of public interest.

The Main pillars of the PBIA 2024–2028 are:

  • Expansion of AI research and innovation centers;
  • Tax incentives for startups and public–private partnerships;
  • Training and qualification of AI professionals;
  • Implementation of AI in public services (health, security, education).

This initiative positions Brazil as a regional leader in AI policy, ahead of countries like Mexico, Chile, and Argentina.

Brazil’s private sector is undergoing a phase of rapid AI adoption. By 2025, a national survey identified 396 Brazilian AI companies focused on marketing applications, reflecting diversification across generative AI, automation, analytics, and digital services.

According to a Bain & Company (2025) study, 67% of Brazilian companies now consider AI a strategic priority, a major leap from 2024, when only about 12% had active projects. This demonstrates the transition from experimental use to mature, production-level adoption.

Brazil received international investments and technological infrastructure. That's why Brazil’s consolidation as an AI hub also stems from the confidence of major global players. In September 2024, Microsoft announced a US$ 2.7 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure in Brazil, one of the largest technology investments in Latin American history. In 2025, Eletrobras partnered with C3 AI to modernize Brazil’s power grid using AI and machine learning, highlighting the industrial applications of advanced technologies.

These moves strengthen Brazil’s position as a regional hub for data and high-performance computing, essential for scaling generative AI and automation initiatives.

Despite major progress, Brazil still faces structural challenges. A SAP Brazil (March 2025) survey revealed that:

  • 29% of companies lack clarity on how to integrate AI into their business systems;
  • 28% cite a shortage of skilled professionals as the main obstacle.

On the regulatory front, Brazil has emerged as a key player. In 2024, the National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) suspended Meta Platforms’ privacy policy, which used Brazilians’ personal data to train generative AI models. This decision marked an important milestone in ethical governance and digital sovereignty, aligning Brazil with European-style data protection principles.

The main sectors driving AI growth in Brazil include:

  • Finance and digital payments: automation and predictive analytics;
  • Energy: smart grids and real-time system optimization;
  • Agribusiness: crop forecasting and climate analytics;
  • Healthcare: assisted diagnostics and telemedicine;
  • Public administration: chatbots and natural language processing for citizen services.

These industries attract investments from both large corporations and local startups, making Brazil a fertile ground for experimentation and innovation.

About the Outlook for 2025 and Beyond the trends indicate continued expansion of generative AI and process automation in Brazilian companies. By the end of 2025, it is expected that:

  • Over 60% of corporate AI solutions in Brazil will involve generative models;
  • The country will consolidate international research and training partnerships;
  • The General Artificial Intelligence Law (under discussion in Congress) will advance the national governance framework.

With growing public and private investments, Brazil is on track to become a Latin American reference in AI innovation and ethics, combining economic growth with responsible technological governance.

The 2024–2025 period marks a strategic turning point for AI in Brazil, shifting from an emerging topic to a core pillar of industrial and business competitiveness. The alignment between government vision, international investments, and technological maturity positions Brazil as one of the leading AI hubs in the Southern Hemisphere, with the potential to export technology, talent, and regulatory best practices.

At MakeValue, we develop AI-powered applications for SAP Finance, focused on enhancing financial visibility and decision-making. Our Cash Flow Intelligence App leverages data from Supply Chain, Sales, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and real-time Bank Balances to deliver accurate forecasting and scenario simulation, ensuring that financial teams have a clear, data-driven view of their company’s liquidity at any time.

Is your company already exploring AI implementation projects? In which sectors or business processes are you seeing the greatest potential for transformation?

References

  • Reuters: Microsoft to invest $2.7 billion in Brazil
  • Reuters: Brazil proposes $4 billion AI investment plan
  • SAP News Brazil (2025): Brazil leads in AI adoption among enterprises
  • Bain & Company (2025): Artificial Intelligence Adoption Survey
  • Instituto IA – LNCC (2024–2025): Mapping of AI Research Groups in Brazil
  • Poder360 (2024): Brazil to become Latin America’s AI hub with R$ 22 billion by 2028

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching—the premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

🔗Explore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center’s AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

🔗Calculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

🔗Explore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

🔗Access the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

🔗Discover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with five new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

🚀Activate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
🚀Setup of Joule in Mobile Start
🚀Accelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
🚀Migrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
🚀Accelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

🔗 Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform – Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

🔗https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just features—they're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025—make it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP’s New Logistics Management Module: A Cloud-Native Approach to Smarter Regional Supply Chains
entry.content:
What Is SAP Logistics Management?

SAP Logistics Management is a modern SaaS-based logistics solution built on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
It brings together warehousing, transportation management, and partner collaboration in a single, integrated system — particularly suited for regional or satellite operations — while connecting seamlessly with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Key Attributes

  • Cloud-native: Designed for seamless scalability, continuous innovation, and rapid deployment.
  • Unified logistics approach: Combines warehouse, transport execution, orchestration, and partner collaboration into one platform.
  • Native ERP integration: Connects easily with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP S/4HANA without heavy customization.
  • Carrier & partner collaboration: Built-in connectivity through the SAP Business Network for real-time visibility and data sharing.
  • AI-powered operations (Joule): Leverages SAP Joule AI assistants to automate tasks, guide decisions, and reduce manual workload.

In short, SAP Logistics Management doesn’t replace heavy-duty logistics systems like SAP EWM or SAP TM, but rather extends SAP’s portfolio with a lighter, agile, intelligent logistics layer — ideal for regional warehouses and distributed networks.

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Core Capabilities & Business Impact

 

Function

Business Impact

Warehouse & transport execution

Reduces manual coordination and errors

Real-time visibility

Enables proactive decision-making

Dock & appointment scheduling

Improves yard efficiency

AI-guided automation

Speeds up repetitive tasks

Integrated partner collaboration

Boosts transparency across the supply chain

 

Feature Highlights

Feature Area

What It Enables

Why It Matters

Warehouse execution

Pick/pack, wave management, dock scheduling, inventory movements

Smooth internal operations, less idle time

Transportation & dispatching

Route planning, dispatching, and execution

Better shipment coordination

Network collaboration

Real-time status, carrier integration, partner communication

Reduces blind spots, accelerates response

Appointment & dock scheduling

Dock/gate management

Reduces queuing, improves yard efficiency

AI automation (Joule)

Decision support, task automation

Frees up planners and boosts productivity

ERP integration

Out-of-the-box connectivity with SAP Cloud ERP

Minimizes custom development

Scalable deployment

Rapid implementation for smaller logistics nodes

Supports multi-tier logistics networks

 

Positioning Within the SAP Ecosystem

SAP positions this module as a bridge for distributed logistics operations, extending logistics capabilities to smaller or regional nodes. It complements — not replaces — SAP Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) and SAP Transportation Management (TM).

Where It Fits:

SAP Product

Complexity

Ideal For

Deployment

SAP EWM

High

Central hubs

On-prem / Cloud

SAP TM

High

Complex transport networks

On-prem / Cloud

SAP Logistics Management

Medium / Low

Regional / Satellite nodes

Cloud-native

Because it’s built on SAP BTP and integrates with SAP Business Network and Joule AI, the new module aligns with SAP’s vision of an intelligent, integrated supply chain.
SAP announced that general availability is expected in Q1 2026.

Benefits & Business Value

Adopting SAP Logistics Management can deliver both operational and strategic gains:

  1. Reduced operational friction: Unified logistics reduces manual handoffs and integration gaps.
  2. Faster deployment for regional nodes: Cloud-native architecture enables quicker rollouts and lower implementation costs.
  3. Improved visibility & collaboration: Real-time tracking and partner integration enhance transparency and agility.
  4. AI-driven decision support: Joule AI assists planners, automates routine actions, and reduces human error.
  5. Scalable, modular growth: Deploy gradually across logistics nodes without disrupting existing core systems.
  6. Resilient and agile operations: Respond faster to disruptions and maintain consistent service levels.
  7. Network consistency: Standardized processes and data across multiple logistics layers ensure global alignment.

Key Challenges & Considerations

While promising, success depends on thoughtful execution.
Organizations should anticipate and plan for:

  • Scope & complexity limits: The module is optimized for low-to-medium complexity; large hubs may still need EWM + TM.
  • Data integration & master data quality: Consistent, clean master data is critical for seamless performance.
  • Change management: AI-driven workflows require user adoption and training.
  • Phased rollout strategy: Identify pilot nodes and migration paths carefully.
  • Carrier & partner readiness: True collaboration depends on network adoption.
  • Monitoring & exception handling: Maintain human oversight during early automation phases.
  • Cost vs. ROI alignment: Evaluate expected efficiency gains against investment costs.

 

What Businesses Should Do Next

If your organization already runs SAP Cloud ERP or S/4HANA, this launch presents a real opportunity to modernize logistics without starting from scratch.

Recommended Next Steps

  • Map your logistics footprint: Identify which regional or satellite nodes would benefit most.
  • Start with pilot deployments: Test configurations, training, and ROI in smaller sites.
  • Ensure data readiness: Clean up and harmonize master data across materials, locations, and partners.
  • Engage carriers early: Align carriers and logistics partners with the collaboration network from the start.
  • Plan coexistence: Integrate with existing EWM/TM during the transition phase.
  • Adopt AI in stages: Roll out automation features gradually and monitor outcomes.
  • Track KPIs from day one: Measure order throughput, dock utilization, exception rates, and on-time delivery.

Conclusion 

The introduction of SAP Logistics Management marks a pivotal step in SAP’s supply chain evolution — moving toward networked, intelligent, and modular logistics.

With its cloud-native architecture, AI-powered automation, and embedded collaboration, it offers a compelling value proposition for companies with multi-tier logistics footprints.

Ultimately, success will depend on data readiness, partner engagement, and phased adoption — but for organizations ready to embrace intelligent logistics, SAP is clearly paving the way for smarter, more connected supply chains.

Thank you for reading.
